intro: Calyptranthes leptoclada, commonly known as the slender-leaved calyptranthe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by small, berry-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in shaded garden settings.
